title: The grand opening of the MES HE3DA battery factory will take place in September
notes:
Location:
The battery production plant is located in Horní Suchá near Havířov in the north of the Czech Republic.

Capacity:
The planned capacity of the Magna Energy Storage (MES) manufacturing plant for the HE3DA batteries is not explicitly mentioned in the provided information.

Investment amounts:
The specific capital invested in the project or announced planned investment is not provided in the given text. However, it is mentioned that the project has attracted many investors and is being financed by Radomír Prus.

Project progress:
The Magna Energy Storage (MES) manufacturing plant for the HE3DA batteries is set to be officially opened on Thursday, September 17, 2020. The production technologies are being finalized, and the batteries are undergoing a series of tests. The plant is described as one of the first to be completely robotized and automated, meeting the requirements for Industry 4.0 qualification.

Project type:
The project is a new build, as it is a wholly Czech-conceived and realized factory in the Moravian-Silesian region of the Czech Republic.

Value chain stages:
The text mentions that the HE3DA battery production will serve as energy storage banks in two initial areas of demand: modular units for on-demand energy storage installations and efficient powerpacks for the electric vehicle industry. However, specific details about the stages covered at the facility, such as cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly, are not provided.

title: Magna Energy Storage (M.E.S.)
notes:
Location:
- The Magna Energy Storage (M.E.S.) project is located in the Czech Republic, specifically in the František industrial zone in Horní Suchá near the city of Havířov.

Capacity:
- The planned capacity of the project is not explicitly mentioned in the provided information.

Investment amounts:
- The construction and technology of the factory cost approximately CZK 1.4 billion (EUR 52 million).

Project progress:
- The project officially opened a new plant for the production of high-capacity batteries in September 2020 and plans to start commercial production at the beginning of 2021. The employment effect is expected to start from January 2021 and continue until December 2025.

Project type:
- The project is a new build for the production of high-capacity batteries.

Value chain stages:
- The information does not specify the specific stages of the battery production value chain covered at the facility.

title: Stavba továrny na baterie budoucnosti začala. V Horní Suché dokáží zpracovat všechno české lithium
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in the Czech Republic, specifically in the Silesian brownfield area.

Capacity:
- The factory is planned to have an annual production capacity of 1.2 gigawatt-hours, with a potential expansion to 15 gigawatt-hours in the future, and a further possible expansion to 30 gigawatt-hours.

Investment amounts:
- N/A

Project progress:
- The project is expected to start production at the end of 2019. The factory is planned to be fully operational and highly automated, with a focus on exporting batteries. The workforce is projected to grow from 250 initially to potentially hundreds more after the production expansion.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, as it involves the construction of a fully robotized factory.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the entire value chain, from processing lithium to active materials, to the production of usable batteries. Additionally, there are plans for the involvement of Czech chemical companies in the processing of lithium into active materials and the subsequent recycling of battery cores.

title: EN Magna Energy storage a.s.
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in the František Industrial Zone, Horní Suchá, Czech Republic.

Capacity:
- The first fully automated pilot production line has a capacity of 10 MWh per year. The planned production technology is 1.2 GWh per year.

Investment amounts:
- N/A

Project progress:
- The first fully automated pilot production line of HE3DA® 3D batteries with a production capacity of 10 MWh per year was put into operation in December 2016 in Prague - Letňany. The planned production launch for the new manufacturing plant in the František Industrial Zone is in 2020.

Project type:
- The project involves the construction of a new manufacturing plant for the production of high-capacity batteries.

Value chain stages:
- The facility covers the stages of cell fabrication and module assembly.
